results.title: Master builder: Pier Luigi Nervi
results.creator_credit: Denis Postle, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Nervi is first and foremost a master craftsman, but he also has an original and revolutionary creative mind. He has an obsession for what he believes to be the supreme building material - a type of reinforced concrete. With it he has built some of the world’s most famous buildings, faster and cheaper than anyone else. The buildings for the Rome Olympics, the Pirelli building in Milan, the Unesco building in Paris, have helped build Nervi’s international reputation as a builder of tomorrow. Commentary written by Anthony Jay, spoken by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Masseur
results.creator_credit: John O'Brien, Helen Linthorne and Donna Cavanough
results.brief_description: The power of touch is highlighted in this short drama about an old man who experiences an outpouring of hidden emotions and grief after receiving a massage.

results.title: Mass of the electron
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services
results.brief_description: Using a cathode ray tube encircled by a current carrying a loop of wire, measurements are taken which enable the demonstrator to calculate the mass of the electron with reference to the Millikan Experiment. The calculations are brought out in detail step by step. Part of a course in physics for Secondary Schools by Prof. Eric M. Rogers, Princeton University.

results.title: Mass media and adult education
results.creator_credit: Rudolf Krejcik, Kratky Film and Unesco
results.brief_description: Radio, television, film, the press and books have become a part of our immediate environment. Cassettes, teledistribution, satellites and other new techniques of information storage, processing and broadcasting will be equally familiar to us before long. The film shows experiments being made to help the promotion and development of adult education in Canada, Colombia, India, Japan, Tunisia, USA, USSR, & Zambia.

results.title: Mass and weight
results.brief_description: Shows the behaviour of a bowling ball in an actual bowling alley, and in imaginary alleys at the North Pole, at the Equator, on the moon and in intergalactic space to explore the concepts of mass and weight. Explains the relationship between gravitational and inertial mass.

results.title: Masonry: preparation of plane surfaces
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the method of preparing a plane stone surface by cutting in corners and drafts and finally removing the remainder of the excess stone. A clean face is obtained with the help of sand and york stone and carborundum. From this clean face, adjoining sides can be accurately worked and checked. Tools that are used include the pitching tool, drafting chisel, punch, claw tool and boaster.

results.title: Masonry: moulded work
results.brief_description: An ovolo moulding has been selected as an example. The working of this is demonstrated in detail, zinc template giving the section, cutting the main chamfer, fillets and further chamfers and the use of the boaster to finish the job. The method of working a return end is also shown.

results.title: Masculine or feminine: your role in society
results.creator_credit: J William Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: In live interviews, people with differing backgrounds and attitudes examine “masculine” and “feminine” roles in society during the 1970’s. In the wake of feminism as a social context of the time (1970), this film examines how the explicit boundaries dividing masculinity and femininity have become increasingly blurred. Areas looked at are work, domesticity and marriage.

results.title: Masai in Tanzania
results.brief_description: A look at the famed African warrior tribe, the Masai, noted for their height and lack of Negroid features. The women are viewed going about their household tasks and preparing materials for the building of a new home. The Masai now have peaceful trading relations with neighbouring tribes whereas before, when weapons were carried in the market-place there were bloody battles at trading sites.

results.title: Mary Lewis -Student Nurse
results.brief_description: The story of a young girl’s three years’ training to becomes a States Registered Nurse in London. Follows the student’s life on and off duty, shows the comprehensive training received, and indicates the opportunities in various fields of nursing open to girls who qualify.
